intro: Bartsia biloba, commonly known as the lesser bartsia, is a small flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and thickets. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Bartsia biloba has fleshy, scale-like leaves and produces tiny seeds that are dispersed by wind.
